DOC.detailed_description: Background : Congenital abnormally shape womb ( uterine malformation ) long thought common woman poor pregnancy outcome , e.g . miscarriage ( Rackow Arici 2007 ) preterm delivery ( Tomazevic , Ban-Frangez et al . 2007 ) . However , true prevalence difficult ass universally agree classification system best investigation invasive . In addition , previous prevalence study examine detail subfertility pregnancy loss , duration subfertility , gestation pregnancy loss , miscarriage pattern . Aims : We plan investigate common uterine malformation high-risk woman ( history miscarriage preterm delivery ) , analyse different characteristic group . This study also investigate ultrasound characteristic detect woman . This study point towards possible mechanism uterine malformation may affect pregnancy outcomes . Methods : We plan recruit woman miscarriage preterm delivery study . A sample woman normal term delivery recruit comparison . All woman undergo one 3-dimensional ultrasound scan . Outcomes : The proportion woman congenital uterine malformation determine . Any ultrasound-detected marker find especially woman poor pregnancy outcome may point towards uterine malformation affect pregnancy .
